abstract: Ginia Bellafante Big City column criticizes growing antipathy to homeless people in New York City from those, in particular former Mayor Rudolph W Giuliani, who consider very presence of homeless to be a gross inconvenience; notes several upcoming movie releases that take a more nuanced and sympathetic view; holds homelessness is not terrible because it offends city's aesthetics but because it ruins human lives.
lead_paragraph: In an interview with NBC’s local news channel in New York, former mayor Rudy Giuliani complained about a homeless man who had taken up residence on his block.

headline.main: Rudolph Giuliani’s Outrage on Homelessness, and Richard Gere’s
